text: On 2 November 2020, three gunmen stormed the campus of Kabul University in Kabul, Afghanistan. They killed 32 people and wounded 50 others. The attack began around the time government officials were to arrive at the campus for the opening of an Iranian book fair. The three gunmen were later killed during a fight with security forces. The attack happened at around 11:00 AM in the morning. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant claims responsibility for the attack. ==References== Category:2020 in Afghanistan Category:2020s murders in Asia 2020 University attack Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in Asia Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in the 2020s Category:Crime in Afghanistan Category:Islamic State Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Asia Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2020s Category:Mass murder in 2020 Category:Mass murder in Asia Category:2020 mass shootings in Asia Category:November 2020 events Category:University and college shootings Category:Terrorist incidents in Asia in 2020
title: 2020 Kabul University attack
